meanings.definition: Approach and address (someone) boldly or aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The stranger kept accosting me on the street, making me feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson accosted every customer who entered the store, trying to make a sale.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel accosted the bird feeder, determined to get its share of seeds.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds accosted the peaceful sky, bringing thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent5: The detective accosted the suspect with tough questions, trying to solve the case.

meanings.definition: To approach and speak to (someone) in an aggressive or unwelcome way.
meanings.sent1: The bully accosted the smaller kids during recess, demanding their lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The paparazzi accosted the celebrity as she left the restaurant, flashing cameras in her face.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat accosted the sleeping dog, trying to wake it up for playtime.
meanings.sent4: The loud music accosted my ears as I walked past the nightclub.
meanings.sent5: The aggressive driver accosted me on the highway, honking and tailgating.
